history.content: It’s more important that you have taken some physics classes on EM, e.g., Physics 7B, or even 7C, since this class will be about optics and Maxwell’s equations. 16A,B are not that important.

children.subject: https://hkn.eecs.berkeley.edu/courseguides/EE/118 Here is a detailed description of the course. This class is on optics, but classical EM is fundamental description of light (before going into QED) so it’ll help you understand the wave natural of light better.
I looked at the link and it was very helpful, thank you! I am a little bit confused though on the structure of this course; are there no exams? Wondering if this course is project-based or exam-based

Thanks Anonymous Comp! Is EE118 a class on E&M? The course description describes the course as one on optics. Maybe I'm not fully comprehending the course description then but what does the course cover exactly?

Also, any thoughts on the instructor (Prof Kante)?

history.content:
Hi! Is it necessary to take EE16A and EE16B to do well in the course Electrical Engineering 118? 

I ask because the Berkeley Course Guide lists Math 53, EE16A and EE16B, or Math 54 as prerequisites. I have taken Math 53 and a linear algebra course (so basically Math 54), but have not taken EE16A or EE16B. Are these courses necessary/important to do well in EE118?
history.subject: EE 118

history.content:
Hi! If you have taken Electrical Engineering 118: Is it necessary to take EE16A and EE16B to do well in this course? 

I ask because the Berkeley Course Guide lists Math 53, EE16A and EE16B, or Math 54 as prerequisites. I have taken Math 53 and a linear algebra course (so basically Math 54), but have not taken EE16A or EE16B. Are these courses necessary/important to do well?
